p: Type 1 DM was induced by fasting rats overnight prior to intraperitoneal (i.p.) injection with a fresh solution of STZ [50 mg/kg body weight (bwt) in 0.1 M citrate buffer (pH 4.5)]. Blood glucose levels were assessed after 72 h by pricking ratsâ€™ tail to extract blood, which was assessed using a glucometer. Rats with a blood glucose level exceeding 200 mg/dL were considered diabetic and selected for experimentation ( Qinna and Badwan, 2015). In this study, rats exhibited blood glucose values between 433 and 594 mg/dL.
